text: Syagrus calcaratus is a species of leaf beetle. It is distributed in Guinea, the Democratic Republic of the Congo, Senegal, Nigeria, Ghana and Sudan. It was first described by Johan Christian Fabricius in 1775. Syagrus calcaratus is a pest of cotton. The larvae attack the roots of the plant and cause it to wilt. Other host plants for the species include Parinari curatellifolia. ==References== Category:Eumolpinae Category:Beetles of the Democratic Republic of the Congo Category:Insects of West Africa Category:Insects of Sudan Category:Taxa named by Johan Christian Fabricius Category:Beetles described in 1775
title: Syagrus calcaratus
